Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: nad234
Reviews.Content: The hotel locate 10 min walk from the city center. there is a lot of free parking just across the street. the breakfast was great! When I registered I look for hotel with free wireless. 3 days they had a problem with the internet but they let me to choose if I want to move other hotel with internet free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Close to metro (U)”
Reviews.Author: Andrey M
Reviews.Content: Close to the red line subway, modern rooms, all nonsmoking, reception does not work at night, good internet and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky room & got stuck outside the hotel at 1am with -8 C!”
Reviews.Author: acumpreto
Reviews.Content: AVOID this hotel, especially if you dont smoke or are a woman traveling on your own. Got a room that stunk of smoke and then got stuck outside the hotel at 1am with -8 degrees cause the front door hadn't been fixed and you couldnt open it! No reception there and the "Emergency" phone number didnt work either!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! for a detailed review read the rest. The place is very central and opposite the U Bahn that is very practical. Also very cheep for the size of the room and the quality of the hotel. Reception staff was ok too. Generally seems like a great option if you wanna visit Berlin and good value for money. BUT! The room stunk of smoke, it was awful. I hadn't asked for a smoking room and I got one that smelled really bad, I aired it and it still smelled. If you dont like this kind of surprises AVOID it! Worse thing was that the reception closes after 11pm. I was there for an event (work) and got back at 1am, the door outside wouldn't open. The electronic card worked perfectly but I stayed there for more than 10 minutes trying to open it, pulling hard etc but nothing happened. Now, I'm a girl, trying to get in a hotel at 1am in the night, with -8 degrees C, comletely freezing and trying to find a way to get inside. The doesn't have a lot of lights and because it's next to the U Bahn station it's kind of dodgy. There were some drunken and other weird people from really cheep bars across the street waking by that were worrying me too. They had a papaer on the door saying if you have a problem to call 2 numbers, one was for Emergency. I dialed it and it takes you through the reservations line, I was on it for more than 5 minutes and no one picked up.. what kind of emergency line is this!!!!!!!!!!!!! Lastly they had an other hotel that was one block away that you could walk to and ask for help, seems like it's affiliated to them. You had to walk past the dodgy bars to get there. The guy from the reception said the door is "heavy" and needs a strong pull and after I told him I was pulling for 10 minutes he mentioned that they're telling the hotel management to fix the door every day but they're not doing anything. I dont get it, we pay for our rooms and they cant take that money and FIX THE DOOR SO WE CAN GET TO OUR ROOMS???!!!! The guy was really tall and strong and even HE had trouble opening the door. I find it UNEXEPTABLE that a hotel doesn't fix the front door in such an area, and puts it's clients to risk . I would NOT RECOMMEND you go anywhere near this hotel, unless you reeeeallly dont care what will happen to you. There are other really cheep hotels near by that are better and cheep too, I just didn't know about them unfortunatelly.

Reviews.Title: “Strong in every item”
Reviews.Author: Joakkin
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel near to Potsdamer Platz. Location is pretty good, just 10 minutes walking from PP; the rooms are comfortable, nice beds, big space and quiet floors. The attention is pretty good as well and the relation price-service is more than satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location but not suitable for all.”
Reviews.Author: mattfromlancs
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and of a very good standard for a price which is not much more than budget in Berlin. Cleanliness is excellent, as is the bathroom. There are a few odd choices which detract slightly (single duvets on double beds, really cheap sticking cubicle despite the superb shower etc.), but overall anyone who doesn't hate slightly soulless décor will be very happy. The staff were very helpful once asked questions, but didn't tell you much before that. Location is in Schonfeld, just outside the Mitte (in other words not quite city centre, but almost). Its right opposite a subway station and very close to shops and restaurants. Another review suggested the location is sleazy- I think they are wrong. Its right in the gay district, but not rough or even too much of a party spot despite bars nearby. The one big problem was sleep quality. The bed wasn't mega comfy, the rooms are warm and the electric blinds don't close fully so the room is not fully dark. If you're a light sleeper this mightn't be the hotel for you, but for most people it's a real find.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnFromSheffield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Excellent little hotel for the money. Comfortable, large, quiet warm rooms with excellent shower! Didn't eat breakfast although it all looked nice. Friendly, helpful reception too. Approximately 20 minute walk from Sony Centre (to the North) and KaDeWe (East). As others have mentioned, there's a few ladies of the night in the area, but they ignore tourists so not really an issue. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Simon Y
Reviews.Content: I must admit after reading some of the reviews about this place, I almost cancelled our reservation and booked elsewhere. I'm glad I didn't. I'm not saying people haven't had bad experiences here, but the wording of some of the ratings seemed to lean towards doing the utmost to put you off and ruin future custom for the Hotel. Our experience? Very, very good. Located right next the U2 line (and only a couple of hundred yards away from the central U1 line) it's ideal for getting all around Berlin. You could be in the city centre in about 10 minutes. We were made very welcome by the man on Reception when we arrived and the other staff we spoke to over the 5 days we stayed were also very pleasant. The room was on the 1st floor facing the station opposite, which meant if your curtains were open, people could see right into the room if they wanted to. Cleanliness of the room was excellent and it was large and spacious. Maid service was every day if you wanted. We expected it to be noisy, but it wasn't at all. The only down sides to the room? The lighting was a bit dim and there was no kettle. That was all. I'm sorry, but even that wasn't enough to persuade us this place was going to be verbally trashed on "tripadvisor". As far as the area goes? Yes, some people had commented on prostitutes hanging around the station at night and there were. About 5 or 6 of them, hardly throngs of them hassling you in the street. Not once did we feel unsafe in the neighbourhood day or night. It felt a lot safer than in the U.K!! We never had breakfast at the hotel (which was a buffet/continental at 7 Euros 50). There are plenty places only a couple of stops away on the U-Bahn where you can get it for 6 Euros or so. Go to Cafe Alex in the Sony Centre (Potsdamer Platz) and you can get all you can eat for 6.20 until about 11am. If you get hungry very late at night, go out the hotel door, turn right and literally opposite the LSD sex shop at Kurfursten Str (best way to describe where it is), there is a small take-away stall with a really friendly old guy and the food was excellent. Huge Durum chicken kebab for 3 Euros. 15-20 minutes walk in the other opposite direction, in a straight line, is an excellent Vietnamese restaurant situated right on a corner (sorry, can't remember the name of it). Nice and cheap, too. All in all, we would go back and stay here again. We would recommend it and what I would say to other previous reviewers who slated it is save up your money and stay in The Ritz or Hilton at Potsdamer Platz if that's the quality of accommodation you strive for. Above all, just go to Berlin and enjoy it for the wonderful and amazing place it is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location and huuuge rooms”
Reviews.Author: mostorm
Reviews.Content: We went on our first trip to Berlin for an extended weekend (Thursday night to Sunday afternoon) and booked at this hotel, because with had received a gift certificate. So not a choice of our own! But it turned out to be a great place to stay - and I have difficulties recognizing some of the previous and not so positive reviews. The hotel is situated right next to the Bülow Str. U-Bahn station, albeit this was shut down during our visit. However Kurfürstenstr. station is only two blocks away. We got a room at the fifth floor, and it is possibly the largest hotel room, that we have ever stayed in. It had an okay furnishing and large panorama windows giving a nice view of the surrounding city. We had booked with breakfast included, and had a pleasant experience here as well with different assortments of egg, bread, cheese, sausages, ham, fresh fruit, jams and whatever belongs to a breakfast buffet. On departure we were allowed to let our car stay in the hotel parking cellar and pick it up in the afternoon. Reception staff was very friendly at every occasion. We will definitely return on our next trip to this fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Not going back”
Reviews.Author: Elinhs
Reviews.Content: Well, I can't really comment on the standard of the hotel... other than a nice reception. The fact is that on my arrival, I got the following message from one of employees at the reception "I'm sorry, but you can't stay here". I had prior to this written an e-mail just to make sure that the booking had been registered. The answer to this was positive, and that I was very much welcome to stay at their hotel. Or not.. Apparently, their booking system had broken down one day prior to my arrival, and therefor they had recieved an overwhelming (?) amount of bookings, which had led to a fully booked hotel and no room for me. All of this does sound a bit strange considering I had already gotten an e-mail confirming that my booking was recieved and everything was fine. Luckily (?), they managed to get me a room at Aldea Novum hotel (sister hotel), down the street. No costs came in addition. I find it strange that the hotel did not contact their future guests to inform them about the situation. To be given a message like this at the reception by a person who seems just as confused as I was, is not the best way to handle it. Hopefully there hasn't been too many guests with the same experience as me..

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel that has potential but fails on nearly every point - run down”
Reviews.Author: Bugbeaky
Reviews.Content: Our trip to New York was cancelled due to the hurricane so we thought we'd use our New York budget for Berlin and spend more than usual to treat ourselves to an expensive room that looks great from their photos. Plus side - a truly huge duplex room that was clearly once amazing = virtually an apartment with two balconies HOWEVER..... Gym extra though not listed as such. 5euro per person per day!! When questioned two days later we got free access to it in the end, but only to find that it's virtually none existent = three non functioning machines and a switched off sauna. You need to warn them two hours before if you wish to use it!! The room itself was huuuuge, but very poorly maintained. Sockets hanging out of the wall, masses of wall switches that have no apparent function, useless totally ineffective aircon, no safe instructions, smelly furnishings and bedding, blinds broken, tissue thin curtains (and a LOT of windows making it impossible to sleep much past sunrise), and overall just a very very tired room at a chunky price. Add to that that it is on an incredibly busy road and the noise means that I have returned exhausted. Oh and did I mention the prostitutes working the streets outside? Didn't bother us, but all adds up. Additionally the duvets were tiny and two separate ones on a double bed? ...and the pillows un-usable. Room cleaning was minimal - we were there one day to witness how minimal. Dust bunnies under the bed, dirty furnishings etc. At one point pillowcase removed and not replaced? Bedroom had stained rugs and visibly dirty armchairs. The lounge had no ceiling lights, just free standing uplights. The bedroom had no bedside lights just an uplighter with a broken switch. The bed was positioned in front of units that meant they didn't open fully = just odd. Though to be fair masses of cupboards, but no hangers until asked. Downstairs the 'dining' area had badly stained carpets and a kitchen in a cupboard but no cups/kettle etc. When asked I was told not to use the kitchen as 'although it was there it mustn't be used as dangerous' and I quote!!! One of the two lifts was constantly out of order. They did supply a kettle though when asked and staff were pleasant if a rather ineffective. The station outside the hotel is shut btw - not the hotel's fault but inconvenient. Overall it's a great shame as it's just that this hotel does the absolute bare minimum. The gym should work and be accessible The blinds should work The electrics and lighting should be safe and work The kitchen should either be working or removed The curtains should block out light The windows should black out noise. You should be able to sleep in a hotel room. Not much to ask? Do not book this room as a treat or this hotel if you expect anything more than sleepless basic. It was more of a spacious student hostel than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but certainly not a great one.”
Reviews.Author: Alexs94
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 10 nights. The stuff was nice and helful, and the hotel was modern and beautyful. The hotel is located near a U-Bhan station and has a great transport connections. On the other hand, we got the impresion that the nigherhood is not so good, in the night you can see some ladys offering Service, and overall the public was owful. Also, I was on the third, small bad, and it was terrible, really really unbearable. I told that to the reception, but they never did much about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel as a base point to explore! Good value, would stay again, also very dog friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: funsunlover2
Reviews.Content: We are currently living out in Germany and making the most out of being able to explore the different cities. Berlin was quite some distance so when we had a long weekend decided to make the most of it and come visit. It was a straight forward 4 hour drive for us with not too many complicated turns until we hit Berlin! When we arrived, due to other peoples reviews we expected underground parking. This is not the case and the parking is now for the Bank. However there is free parking around the side of the hotel - and possibly under the railway line. We parked there no problems and the car was fine!! The hotel staff gave us a warm welcome and the dog and they helped ferry all of our kit up to our room for us and back from the room to the hotel! The hotel itself is basic. We had a double room for the two of us and out 1 year old chocolate labrador (She cost us an extra 10 euro's a night.) The room itself is basic, a kingsize bed (although you get 2 single duvets (What is that all about???) and 1 pillow each, you can ask for another, We also asked during our reservation for non feather pillows due to my allergies and these where provided.), a desk and chair, a single arm chair and footstool, wardrobe (with a safe in it, although we couldnt get ours working), 2 bedside tables, several lamps and a bathroom big enough to swing a cat (the dog enjoyed lying in there on the cool tiles after a long days walk). One downside of the bathroom was the shower cubicle itself is raised nearly 3/4 of a meter off the ground so when you step out you have to remember the drop is quite a lot otherwise you could smack you head on the sink as you fall. The shower itself is decent enough but could do with a clean - lots of limescale and build up. There are NO tea/coffee facilities which was a let down for me. There is also a tv with german tv, CNN and BBC World service. Also you have free WIFI which I am using to write this review from my chair (ask for the logon codes from reception). There are remnants of the old flats with telephones on the walls and there are electronic controls with a fan and temperature - unsure of what they did but made very little difference. The rooms where cleaned every day and bed made (with duvets put in a nice stylish way.) We also got clean towels every day (Even though we followed the sign on the wall and said we didnt by leaving them on the rail) as well as clean glasses, bins emptied and a general clean. Even though we asked for a courtyard room we still got a main road one and it is VERY VERY noisy!! The shops below are open 24/7 pretty much and you are in the heart of the turkish community! The roads itself are busy and there is constant traffic and germans beeping their horns all day and night (also a tradition if there is a wedding the procession will beep their horns the entire way too and from the church!) so we had to sleep with our windows shut the whole time which made it very stuffy. Luckily we had brought our own fan with us to keep us and the dog cool and that was on constantly. Our room although being a non smoking room still reaked of cigarettes from previous users. I had to clarify it was a non smoking room (despite there being an ashtray in the desk) and we had to have our windows open during the day otherwise when we came back the room smelt of cigarettes. We also got a spray of air spray to try and mask the smell from reception but it worked for a few hours then needed it again so we gave up in the end and left the windows open during the day and shut them at night. The breakfast itself in the hotel we cannot possibly comment on as we never ate in there as we felt 9.50 euros was extortionate. We got breakfast every morning from a lovely bakery at the Kufursten Strasse (green line) but there are enough cafes and bakeries opposite the hotel to eat in. This was only 5 mins walk away (as you head out the hotel turn right up potsdamer str. , under the red line bridge past lots of supermarkets and there on your right.) There are loads of supermarkets around and we went in and brought drinks and food - again something very difficult to get hold of during the day in the hotel and very expensive. They dont mind you taking up food etc to your rooms. The red line (station opposite the hotel) was out of action so we walked up to kufursten strasse line and got the train from there - very easy and machines to buy your tickets. We bought the Welcome to Berlin cards as that entitled us to travel round zone A and B and also discounts for many attractions (list from reception!) Around 16 euros each for 48 hours but Well worth it and we used ours so much! If you want to walk into the "town" where all the shops are its around 20-30 min walk up Bulow strasse onto Kleister Strasse where all the shops are. If you want to tube - take the kufursten Strasse tube and get off and Wittenburg platz. The shops are all up there as well as the many street tour buses for guided tours. Thats what makes this Hotel great to stay in as its really easy to get to most of the main attractions from here. The tubes are VERY busy and well used by the nationals and tourists and once you get the hang of them very easy and quick to use. Just be prepared to smell a lot of arm pits! We also went and visited the Zoo - again green line until Kufurstendam then orange line to Zoological gardens. we used our Welcome to berlin cards and got 25% off entrance. We spent around 6 hours in the park and saw most of the animals there. There are however no dogs allowed so we had to leave the dog in the hotel. We also used the tube to see Checkpoint Charlie, Brandenburg gate and Reichstag. It took around 2 hours of walking and a lot of train changes to get to all 3 (within a good walk of one another) but well worth the visit - we did plan to do the walking tour but missed it, so went off by ourselves. The brandenburg gate has some great toilets near by 50c for a 20 mins and the place automatically disinfects the walls, floor and toilet after every use - great for a germ-a-fobe like me! We ate at a restaurant on Potsdamer strasse about 1-2km walk away from the hotel and also had ice cream at the ice cream place on the corner near the hotel. We also ate in town at the hard rock cafe - thanks to Paul and the waiter (sorry cant remember his name). I would recommend booking though if you want to eat there, they make you wait 45 mins even though there is loadsss of tables free upstairs. They have lots of english speaking staff and menus in english so thats great. I would recommend you barely eat before going there portions are huge and we had a starter and couldnt finish our main which was a shame as we looked forward to dessert! We also ate at a place in the europa shopping centre in town - the bavarian restaurant on the bottom floor which was cheap and cheerful! Our dog had a wonderful time with all the walking we did and the staff in the hotel were very friendly and loved seeing her!! The previous owner had a chocolate labrador and so Indi was a reminder of that dog. They all made a fuss of her and wanted her around which was really nice. The hotel is great as a base point and despite the noise we enjoyed our stay and had a nice time exploring this wonderful city! We would stay in this hotel again however make sure we had a courtyard room!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob188636
Reviews.Content: we were there when it was rebuilt - so the room rate was lower. Excellent breakfast - specially soft boiled eggs! rooms big, equipt with everything - you can even prepare some food. underground parking. The only minus was that reception was till 9p.m. and for the keys you had to go to some shop or sth like that (I don't remember now). Anyway, in general I recommand this hotel. t was a very nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, with caveats”
Reviews.Author: familytravelers54
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Hotel City B, and have mixed reviews. First, the positives: 1. The price was good. 2. It is well located next to a major city train stop, very convenient to all the sights of both the Eastern and Western parts of the city. 3. Internet was free. 4. The breakfast buffet was excellent. 5. Washers and dryers were available (but pricey--5 Euro/load). 6. The staff was helpful. Now, the negatives: 1. Make sure to ask for rooms facing the courtyard, not the street. There is no A/C in the hotel, so you need to keep the windows open to survive. The major street and train stop are noisy all day and night, so sleep is bad on the street side of the hotel. The courtyard-side rooms are much quieter. (and cooler). 2. Not a particularly clean hotel. 3. Flickering automatic hallway lighting gives the place a creepy feeling.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very nice and very well...”
Reviews.Author: viajeros81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and very well located right by the line U2 of the metro. The rooms are surprisingly big, bright and stilish. However the room we got (114) is on the first floor and directly into the street so it is very noisy and there is no privacy since the windows are directly towards the platform of the metro. I couldn't sleep well and the next day I asked to change rooms but it was $25 euros to do so! The girl at the desk offered to send a fan to our room in order to keep the room cool without opening the windows and avoiding the noise a little bit. So if you plan on staying here try to get a room towards the back of the building and on the upper floors. They offer breakfast for $10 euros which we thought it was very expensive and decided to go across the street where there are tons of restaurants, cafes and bakeries to choose from. The hotel also has a sauna at the top floor which we were excited to use until we found out it was $5 euros per person to use... Overall it is a nice hotel and will reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Modern”
Reviews.Author: m0rningbell
Reviews.Content: As soon as we got off the plane we headed to this hotel. It was the first hotel my family and I stayed at while in Europe. First off, the room was simple and modern. Very comfortable, but what I liked most was the view from it's 5th floor. We had the balcony pretty much to ourselves which had an amazing view from the windows that covered the entire wall. It was also convenient because the berlin u-bahn was right across the street which made exploring berlin a lot easier. But of course, we walked for the majority of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Owner is a bully”
Reviews.Author: PeterNsw
Reviews.Content: The room we had and the price were excellent. The staff were also good. Breakfast was v. expensive and we ate elsewhere. There was nowhere to safely store bikes. We were told by reception to take our bikes to the garage - through the foyer- but when the owner saw us he became extremely aggressive and threatened to kick us out of the Hotel. He was a bully. After I explained that we were instructed to do this he calmed down but never apologised. We had a wonderful time in Berlin, but we would never stay at this place again - despite the fact that our room was wonderul.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: bulldognyus
Reviews.Content: My first choice was to stay in Schoneberg, but eveyhting was booked. Hotel B had large rooms. It is right on the Bulowstrasse, which is a busy street but my room was in the back so it was quiet. My friend had a room on the front of the hotel and it was much noisier than mine. The staff was very friendly and helpful and most of them speak English. It is close to the U-Bahn station. One night a friend stayed in my room rather than drive home late at night, and there was an extra fee. I was not prepared for this fee, but my German friends tell me it is customary that the rate is based on occupancy. You are not paying for the entire room, you are paying based on per person. There is a laundry room for which there is a one use fee of 5 Euro All things considered a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a reasonal price!”
Reviews.Author: Lillyvalley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were driving from UK to Berlin for the bank holiday weekend, and we of course needed a hotel that had a car park for our car, and centrally located. I ended up picking this hotel because the price was just right and it appears to be what we were looking for. When we arrived there.. we were given keys for the underground car park, which we were very pleased about, as we felt our car is parked safely and securely. We then checked in at the front desk, but our rooms weren't ready (this was a round 1.3pm), though it did say on our paper work that check in is 3pm. So we headed off to find a restaurant for food and then came back to the hotel, in which we were told our room is now available to us. To our surprise, when I opened the door to our room, the first thing I noticed is the space of the room, lovely large, clean, and airy... with huge windows... although looking over the main road.. it's very well insulated and so you cannot really hear the traffic. The double bed was great, and there's a desk and flat screen TV there. The bathroom ensuite was clean with towels (no bath) but it id have a shower, and as were there for the weekend only that didn't bother us. Around the hotel there are quite a number of restaurants and few supermarkets to buy things, and the best thing about this hotel is that the S bahn is right opposite the hotel just less than a min walk away. just absoultely great for exploring the city... if you don't want to blow your budget! Added bonus was that the staff were helpful and were able to to speak English too..... just had a great time!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel City B
HotelInfo.Address: Potsdamer Strasse 129 | Ecke Bulowstrasse, ex. CitySuites Berlin Potsdamer Strasse, 10783 Berlin, Germany
